page.title: 05FARMING
page.content:
Mr. Slater was born on a farm in Allesley (84 acres). He took up farming as his career and when he married he moved to a smaller annex farm with three fields; but still worked at the larger farm, which he now regards as his 'office' where he goes daily to work. It is mainly a dairy farm but does produce beef cattle too. One of the three fields attached to his smaller farm is left for grazing and the other two are used for silage.
Sometimes, depending on the weather, the field is manured after the first cutting and then a second cutting of silage can take place. Chemicals are also added; these vary as different crops require different ratios of such chemicals such as sulphate of ammonia, nitrogen, potash, etc.
